revisions.rev:
{{pp-semi-blp|small=yes}} {{Infobox musical artist |name = Tyler, The Creator |image = Tyler_the_creator.jpg |background = solo_singer |birth_name = Tyler Okonma |alias = Wolf Haley, Ace, Young Nigga |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|03|06}} |origin = [[Ladera Heights, California|Ladera Heights]], Los Angeles |genre= [[Alternative hip hop]] |occupation = Rapper, record producer, director, actor, graphic artist,[http://www.nytimes.com/2011/05/08/arts/music/tyler-the-creator-of-odd-future-and-goblin.html?pagewanted=all Tyler, the Creator, of Odd Future and 'Goblin' â NYTimes.com] fashion designer[http://vimeo.com/26608736 LUNCH WITH TYLER on Vimeo] |instrument = Vocals, piano, keyboards, drums |years_active = 2007âpresent |label = [[XL Recordings|XL]], [[Odd Future Records]] |associated_acts = [[OFWGKTA]], Casey Veggies |website = [http://oddfuture.com/ oddfuture.com] }} '''Tyler Okonma''' (born March 6, 1991),http://www.oddfuturetalk.com/wiki/Tyler,_the_Creator better known by his stage name '''Tyler, The Creator''', is an American [[Rapping|rapper]], [[record producer]], [[music video director]], [[actor]], [[graphic artist]] and [[fashion designer]] from Los Angeles, currently signed to English independent record label [[XL Recordings]] and his own record label, [[Odd Future Records]]. He is the leader of the [[alternative hip hop]] collective [[OFWGKTA]].{{cite web|author=Caroline Ryder |url=http://www.laweekly.com/2010-10-14/music/the-future-is-odd/ |title=The Future Is Odd â Page 1 â Music â Los Angeles |publisher=LA Weekly |date=October 14, 2010 |accessdate=February 19, 2011}} He has rapped on and produced songs for nearly every OFWGKTA release. He also creates all the artwork for the group's releases and said in an interview with [[DJ Semtex]] that he designs all the groups clothing and other merchandise as well. ==Early life== At the age of 7, Tyler would take the cover out of an album's case and create covers for his own imaginary albums including a tracklist with song times before he could even make music.http://www.formspring.me/wolfhaley/q/250412066404303795{{cite web|author=Haley Longman |url=http://www.teen.com/tyler-the-creator-best-new-artist-facts-bio-photos/#2 |title=10 Things to Know About VMA Winner Tyler, The Creator |work=Teen |date=August 30, 2011 |accessdate=2011-08-30}} At the age of 14, Tyler taught himself how to play piano.{{cite web|author= |url=http://psl.svt.se/psl/2011/4/28/odd-future-ar-tidningen-som-aldrig-gavs-ut-tyler-the-creator-intervjun-del-3/ |title=Odd Future Ã¤r tidningen som aldrig gavs ut (Tyler, The Creator-intervjun del 3) |publisher=SVT â PSL |date=April 28, 2011 |accessdate=May 12, 2011}} ==Music career== ===2009âpresent: ''Bastard'' and ''Goblin''=== On December 25, 2009, Tyler self-released his first album, ''[[Bastard (album)|Bastard]]''. The album was eventually ranked 32nd on Pitchfork Media's list of the Top Albums of 2010. On February 11, 2011, Tyler released the music video for "[[Yonkers (song)|Yonkers]]", the first single from his second album, ''[[Goblin (album)|Goblin]]'', which was released May 10, 2011.{{cite web|url=http://frontpsych.com/2011/05/13/consultation-a-review-of-tyler-the-creators-goblin/ |title=Consultation: A Review of Tyler, The Creatorâs GOBLIN |publisher=frontpsych.com |date= |accessdate=May 13, 2011}} The video has received attention from several online media outlets.{{cite web|url=http://rapfix.mtv.com/2011/02/11/tyler-the-creator-gets-odd-in-yonkers/ |title=Tyler, The Creator Gets Odd In âYonkersâ |publisher=Rapfix.mtv.com |date=February 11, 2011 |accessdate=February 19, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.complex.com/music/2011/02/video-tyler-the-creator-yonkers |title=Video: Tyler, The Creator "Yonkers" |publisher=Complex.com |date=February 11, 2011 |accessdate=February 19, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://stereogum.com/636961/tyler-the-creator-yonkers-video/top-stories/lead-story/ |title=Tyler, The Creator â "Yonkers" Video |publisher=Stereogum |date=February 13, 2011 |accessdate=February 19, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.spin.com/articles/watch-shocking-clip-odd-future-frontman |title=WATCH: Shocking Clip From Odd Future Frontman |publisher=SPIN.com |date=February 11, 2011 |accessdate=February 19, 2011}} An extended version with a third verse can be purchased on [[iTunes]].{{cite web|url=http://itunes.apple.com/us/album/yonkers-single/id419873754 |title=Yonkers â Single by Tyler, The Creator â Download Yonkers â Single on iTunes |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=February 14, 2011 |accessdate=March 2, 2011}} After the release of "Yonkers," Tyler announced that he had signed a one-album deal with [[XL Recordings]].{{cite news|last=Cragg |first=Michael |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/musicblog/2011/feb/17/tyler-creator-yonkers |title=New music: Tyler, the Creator â Yonkers | Music | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date=August 23, 2010 |accessdate=February 19, 2011 |location=London}} Tyler and fellow OFWGKTA member Hodgy Beats made their television debut on February 16, 2011 when they performed "[[Sandwitches]]" on ''[[Late Night with Jimmy Fallon]]''.{{cite web|url=http://www.latenightwithjimmyfallon.com/video/odd-future-sandwitches/1295865 |title=Odd Future: 'Sandwitches' - Video - NBC.com |publisher=Late Night with Jimmy Fallon |date= |accessdate=February 19, 2011}} On March 16, Tyler and Hodgy performed "Yonkers" and "Sandwitches" on the 2011 mtvU Woodie Awards, being joined by other members of Odd Future during "Sandwitches". ''Goblin'' was released on May 10, 2011. During an interview with Tyler for ''[[Interview (magazine)|Interview]]'', [[Waka Flocka Flame]] expressed his interest in collaborating with the Odd Future frontman to direct a music video for him.{{citation |url=http://www.rap-up.com/2011/07/28/waka-flocka-flame-wants-tyler-the-creator-to-direct-his-video/ |title=Waka Flocka Flame Wants Tyler, the Creator To Direct His Video |publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=July 30, 2011 |accessdate=July 30, 2011}} Tyler's third album ''[[Wolf (Tyler, The Creator album)|Wolf]]'' is scheduled for release in 2012. It will contain the instrumentals that Tyler has been making since the age of 15.{{cite web |url=http://svtplay.se/v/2440877/psl/tyler-the-creator-odd-future |title=Tyler, The Creator - Om Odd Future Wolf Gang Kill Them All (Del 6) |work=svtplay.se |language=Swedish |accessdate=September 9, 2011}} Tyler won Best New Artist for "Yonkers" at the [[2011 MTV Video Music Awards]].{{cite web|last=Wilkinson |first=Amy|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1669866/tyler-the-creator-vma-best-new-artist.jhtml|title=Tyler, The Creator Nabs Best New Artist VMA|publisher=MTV News|date=August 29, 2011|accessdate=2011-08-29}} ==Criticism== ===Homophobia=== Tyler has been criticized for his use of [[Homophobia|homophobic]] slurs, in particular, his frequent use of the epithet "[[Faggot (slang)|faggot]]" in his lyrics and on Twitter.{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/musicblog/2011/may/09/hip-hop-homophobia |title=Is hip-hop homophobia at a tipping point? |publisher=Guardian |date= May 10, 2011|accessdate=May 10, 2011 |location=London |first=Alex |last=MacPherson}}{{cite news|url=http://blogs.wsj.com/speakeasy/2011/05/13/odd-future/ |title=Odd Future Plays Secret L.A. Show |publisher=Wall Street Journal |date= May 13, 2011|accessdate=May 13, 2011 |first=Todd |last=Gilchrist}} He has denied accusations of homophobia, stating "I'm not homophobic. I just say 'faggot' and use 'gay' as an adjective to describe stupid shit,"Pattison, Louis (2011) "Tyler, The Creator ''Goblin''", ''[[NME]]'', 14 May 2011, p. 12Lester, Paul (2011) "[http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2011/may/07/tyler-the-creator-odd-future Tyler the Creator in the UK: forget hip-hop, we're the new Sex Pistols!]", ''[[The Guardian]]'', 7 May 2011, retrieved May 14, 2011 and "I'm not homophobic. I just think 'faggot' hits and hurts people."{{cite news|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/musicblog/2011/may/09/hip-hop-homophobia |title=Is hip-hop homophobia at a tipping point? |publisher=Guardian |date= May 10, 2011|accessdate=May 18, 2011 |location=London |first=Alex |last=MacPherson}} However, he later said in an interview with [[MTV]] about the slurs that "Well, I have gay fans and they don't really take it offensive, so I don't know. If it offends you, it offends you. If you call me a nigga, I really don't care, but that's just me, personally. Some people might take it the other way; I personally don't give a shit."{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1665860/tyler-the-creator-defends-lyrics.jhtml |title=Tyler, The Creator Defends His Use Of The Other F-Word |publisher=MTV |date= |accessdate=June 15, 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2011/08/31/glaad-calls-vma-winner-tyler-the-creator-violently-anti-gay/|title=GLAAD calls VMA winner Tyler, The Creator âviolently anti-gayâ|publisher=Pink News|date=August 31, 2011|accessdate=2011-08-31}} ===Misogyny=== {{Main|Misogyny in hip hop culture}} Tyler has also been criticized for his graphic depictions of [[violence against women]] and his [[Misogyny|misogynistic]] lyrics.Wlfson, Sam (May 20, 2011). [http://blogs.telegraph.co.uk/culture/samwolfson/100053520/youd-be-a-fool-to-take-offence-to-the-homophobic-lyrics-of-tyler-the-creator-n-dubz-on-the-other-hand/ "Pop Music is Full of Abuse and Misogyny Already. Tyler, the Creator's Simply on Trend"], ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'', accessed September 27, 2011.Grossmann-Heinze, Dahlia (September 12, 2011).[http://www.campusprogress.org/articles/tyler_the_creator_reignites_debate_about_misogyny_in_music/ "Tyler, the Creator Reignites Debate About Misogyny in Music"]. [[Campus Progress]], accessed September 27, 2011. Brent DiCrescenzo of ''[[Time Out (company)|Time Out Chicago]]'' writes that [[rape]] is a "predominant theme" of ''[[Goblin (album)|Goblin]]''DiCrescenzo, Brent (June 29, 2011). [http://timeoutchicago.com/music-nightlife/14828085/the-case-against-odd-future "The Case against Odd Future"]. Time Out Chicago, accessed September 27, 2011. and Hermione Hoby of ''[[The Guardian]]'' writes that Tyler's "rape and murder fantasies (are) graphic enough to send the vomit rising along with the bile."Hoby, Hermione (May 08, 2011). [http://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2011/may/08/odd-future-tyler-creator-rape "Rappers and rape: the incredible sound and hateful lyrics of Odd Future"]. ''[[The Guardian]]'', accessed September 27, 2011. ''[[The Fader]]'' tallied 68 uses of the term "bitch" over ''[[Goblin (album)|Goblin]]'s'' 73 minutes.Fader Magazine. [http://www.thefader.com/2011/05/10/by-the-numbers-tyler-the-creators-goblin/ "By The Numbers: Tyler, The Creatorâs Goblin"]. Accessed September 27, 2011. Responding to [[Tegan and Sara]]'s criticism of his lyrics,O'Neal, Sean (May 16, 2011). [http://www.avclub.com/articles/today-in-tyler-the-creator-tyler-the-creator-respo,56143/ "Today in Tyler, The Creator: Tyler, The Creator responds to Tegan And Sara's accusation of misogyny in predictable way"]. ''[[The A.V. Club]]'', accessed September 27, 2011. Tyler [[Twitter|tweeted]]: "If Tegan and Sara need some hard dick, hit me up!"Stewart, Allison (May 17, 2011). [http://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/click-track/post/tegan-and-sara-vs-tyler-the-creator-the-internet-reacts/2011/05/17/AFhqus5G_blog.html "Tegan and Sara vs. Tyler, the Creator: The Internet reacts"]. ''[[The Washington Post]]'', accessed September 27, 2011. ==Discography== {{Main|Tyler, The Creator discography|Tyler, The Creator production discography}} * ''[[Bastard (album)|Bastard]]'' (2009) * ''[[Goblin (album)|Goblin]]'' (2011) * ''[[Wolf (Tyler, The Creator album)|Wolf]]'' (2012) == Filmography == {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ccc; ;" ! colspan="4" style="background: LightSteelBlue;" | Television |- style="background:#ccc; ;" !
